content: How can I help you today?

I've been having a lot of trouble sleeping lately. My mind just won’t stop racing at night, and I feel overwhelmed with stress about work and providing for my family. It’s been really tough to deal with, and I’m not sure where to start.

That sounds like a lot to carry all at once. Stress from work and the responsibility of providing for your family can really weigh heavily, especially when it starts affecting sleep. It must be frustrating to feel stuck like this, juggling all these pressures and not even being able to rest. What do you think might be contributing most to the racing thoughts or the overwhelm?

I think the biggest thing is the fear of losing my job. With the way things are at work, I feel like I’m constantly on thin ice, and I can’t stop worrying about what would happen if I got fired. On top of that, I can’t help but think about how it would affect my family, and it makes it hard to calm my mind at night.

It sounds like the fear of job insecurity is really pressing on you, not just for yourself but for your family as well. Trying to balance those concerns with the weight of providing for your loved ones must feel overwhelming. It’s understandable that it’s making it hard for you to relax or find peace at night. What do you think might help you feel even a little more in control or less burdened in this situation?

I’m not really sure. I’ve tried distracting myself by scrolling on my phone, but that doesn’t really help—it just adds to the noise in my head. Honestly, I don’t know what would make me feel more in control right now. Maybe if I could figure out how to shut my brain off at night, things might get a little easier.

It sounds like you’ve been trying to find ways to quiet your mind, but so far, they haven’t given you the relief you’re looking for. Wanting to feel more in control of your thoughts, especially before bed, really makes sense given the stress you’re under. Even though you're unsure about what might help right now, the fact that you're exploring your options shows that you're trying to take steps forward. What else have you thought about doing, or even wanted to try, but haven’t yet?

I honestly haven’t thought too much about what else I could try. I’ve just been stuck in this cycle of stressing and not sleeping. Maybe something like cutting back on my screen time at night or trying to talk about what’s going on more, but I don’t know if that would even work. It’s hard to feel motivated to try new things when I already feel so burnt out.

It sounds like the cycle you’re in—stress leading to poor sleep, and poor sleep adding to the stress—has been really tough to break. Feeling burnt out can make it hard to muster the energy or belief that trying something new might help, even if you have some ideas like cutting back screen time or opening up more about your concerns. It’s understandable to feel unsure or stuck when the challenges feel this big. What do you think might help you spark that motivation, even just a little, to explore these ideas further or to experiment with something different?

Sorry to interrupt, but this is getting a bit overwhelming for me to open up about right now. I think I’m okay to pause here and think about everything we’ve talked about. Thank you for listening and helping me sort through this.
